flawed_nl_solution:
Christopher has 64 quarters so he has 64*0.25 = $<<64*0.25=61.0>>61.0
Karen has 32 quarters so she has 32*0.25 = $<<32*0.25=8.0>>8.0
If Christopher has $61.0 and Karen has $8.0 then Christopher has 61.0-8.0 = $<<61.0-8.0=53.0>>53.0 more than Karen

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 16.0, not 61.0. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
